# **About Me**

Dr. Kyle McKay is an ecological engineer with interests in nature-based solutions, ecosystem restoration, and ecological modeling. He is environmental director for Woolpert, an architecture, engineering, and geospatial company. Prior to his current position, Kyle was a researcher with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers focused on a similar suite of topics. He is on the leadership team of the [Network for Engineering with Nature](https://n-ewn.org/) and actively engages with universities through adjunct faculty positions at the [University of Georgia](https://rivercenter.uga.edu/) and [Brooklyn College](https://www.brooklyn.edu/ees/).

## Education & Licensing

Ph.D., Ecology, University of Georgia, 2014

M.S., Civil Engineering (Environmental Hydrology and Hydraulic Engineering), University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, 2007

B.S., Environmental Engineering, Colorado State University, 2001-2005

Professional Engineer in Georgia (#PE040542), 2016-Present
